title: Fuel Tank - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Always fit new heat pads when fitting a new fuel tank, refer to the Electronics Parts Catalogue.
Make sure the two rubber bushes and spacer are fitted to the fuel tank rear mounting on the frame.
Position the fuel tank to the frame and connect the evaporative canister and drain hoses.
Raise the fuel tank forwards and reconnect the two electrical connectors.
Reconnect the fuel hose by gently pushing inwards until the hose engages with a click.

Slide the double check latch down (towards the spigot) until the release buttons are covered. If the latch will not slide into position, then the fuel hose is not fully home on its spigot and must therefore be refitted correctly.
Lower the fuel tank into position and install the two front fixings and flanged washers. Tighten to
Refit the pivot bolt and a new lock nut. Do not tighten at this stage.
Hold the pivot bolt and tighten the lock nut to
Using proprietary professional automotive workshop equipment approved for fuel handling, refill the fuel tank with the fuel previously removed.
Fuel Tank Bodywork Install LJ2; LK2; LL1
Side Panels - Install LG1; LGX; LJ2; LK2
Start the engine and check carefully for fuel leaks. Rectify as necessary.

Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.

Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Tightening Procedures
Always fit new heat pads when fitting a new fuel tank, refer to the Electronics Parts Catalogue.
Make sure the two rubber bushes and spacer are fitted to the fuel tank rear mounting on the frame.
Position the fuel tank to the frame and connect the evaporative canister and drain hoses.
Raise the fuel tank forwards and reconnect the two electrical connectors.
Reconnect the fuel hose by gently pushing inwards until the hose engages with a click.

Slide the double check latch down (towards the spigot) until the release buttons are covered. If the latch will not slide into position, then the fuel hose is not fully home on its spigot and must therefore be refitted correctly.
Fuel hose
Fuel pump electrical connector (brown)
Fuel level sensor electrical connector (black)
Hose - tank drain
Hose - tank to evaporative canister
Lower the fuel tank into position and install the two front fixings and flanged washers. Tighten to
8 Nm
Refit the pivot bolt and a new lock nut. Do not tighten at this stage.
Front fixing (left side shown)
Lock nut
Pivot bolt
Hold the pivot bolt and tighten the lock nut to
8 Nm
Using proprietary professional automotive workshop equipment approved for fuel handling, refill the fuel tank with the fuel previously removed.
Perform the following operations:
Fuel Tank Bodywork - Installation
Side Panels - Installation
Fairings - Installation
Battery - Installation
Start the engine and check carefully for fuel leaks. Rectify as necessary.
Seat - Installation
